solution_line_template: Daria spends ${couch_cost} + ${table_cost} + ${lamp_cost} on furniture = $<<{couch_cost}+{table_cost}+{lamp_cost}={total_furniture_cost}>>{total_furniture_cost} total on furniture.

Of that ${total_furniture_cost} she spent, she can pay ${initial_payment} now, so ${total_furniture_cost} - ${initial_payment} = $<<{total_furniture_cost}-{initial_payment}={amount_owed_before_interest}>>{amount_owed_before_interest} that Daria still owes.
